column1: Hoskote (historically known as Ooscota or Ooscata) is a taluk in Bangalore Rural District
column2: India. Headquartered at the Hosakote town
column3: it consists of five hoblis - Anugondanahalli

column1: Hoskote was a Jagir of Maratha warrior Shahaji Raje for around 50 years and also part of Swarajya of Shivaji. The Battle of Ooscata in the First British-Mysore War
column2: on the night of 22-23 August 1768 took place here.
Hoskote had a population of 56980. Males constitute 52% of the population and females 48%. Hoskote has an average literacy rate of 86.22%
column3: higher than the state average of 75.36%: male literacy is 89.58%
column4: and female literacy is 82.68%. Hoskote has 11.98% of its population under 6 years of age.
